  • Method Details

    • loadClip

      public static javax.sound.sampled.Clip loadClip​(java.lang.String location)
      Loads a clip from the given location. Due to java restrictions, this must be a wav file and even then it sometimes doesn't work with certain encryptions.
      Parameters:
      location - the file location of the audio clip
      Returns:
      a newly generated clip
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file isn't a wav File and couldn't be loaded
      See Also:
      for non-manual loading

    • play

      public static void play​(javax.sound.sampled.Clip c)
      starts playing the clip
      Parameters:
      c - the clip to play

    • stop

      public static void stop​(javax.sound.sampled.Clip c)
      stops the clip
      Parameters:
      c - the clip to stop

    • loop

      public static void loop​(javax.sound.sampled.Clip c, int... amount)
      plays the clip in an continues loop
      Parameters:
      c - the clip to loop

    • setVolume

      public static void setVolume​(javax.sound.sampled.Clip c, int volume)
      Changes the volume of the clip
      Parameters:
      c - the clip to change the volume on
      volume - the volume to set it to
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the volume is not in range between 0 and 200

    • setVolume

      public static void setVolume​(int volume)
      sets the default volume sounds get played at
      Parameters:
      volume - the volume
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if volume is not in range 0,200
